script: Oh, that's right.
I'm falling to my death. Guess they can't.
How'd it all come to this, you ask?
My end starts at the beginning.
The very beginning.
I had a fairly standard childhood.
I came from what you might call a broken home.
I was eight days old and still living with my parents.
Clearly, it was time to move on.
Here is your Minion. He will take care of you.
Turns out a kid from the Glaupunkt quadrant had the exact same idea.
was born!
Could this be what I was destined for?
Even fate picks its favorites.
No big deal.
Can we keep it?
and wrong.
Mr. Goody Two-Shoes, on the other hand, had life handed to him on a silver platter.
But I had something far, far greater.
My amazing intellect!
A knack for building objects of mayhem.
I was given an opportunity to better myself through learning...
at a strange place called shool.
It was there that I once again He had already amassed a gigantic army of softheaded groupies.
He bought their affections with showmanship and extravagant gifts of deliciousness.
and win over those mindless drones.
Good receives all the praise and adulation, while evil is sent to quiet time in the corner.
While they were learning The Itsy-Bitsy Spider...
I learned how to dehydrate animate objects and rehydrate them at will.
Some days, it felt like it was just me and Minion against the world.
No matter how hard I tried, I was always the odd man out.
The last one picked, the screw-up, the black sheep.
Wait. Maybe it was.
Being bad is the one thing I'm good at!
Then it hit me. If I was the bad boy, then I was going to be the baddest boy of them all!
And so began an enduring, epic, lifelong career.
And I loved it!
Our battles quickly got more elaborate.
He would win some.
I would almost win others.
He took the name Metro Man.
Defender of Metrocity.
I decided to pick something a little more humble.
Megamind!
Incredibly handsome criminal genius and master of all villainy!
Hey!
Great news. I'm a changed man and...
and I'm ready to reenter society as a solid citizen.
You're a villain! And you'll always be a villain.
You'll never change. And you'll never leave.
-You're fun. -You got a present in the mail.
-Is it a puppy? -From Metro Man.
To count every second of your 85 life sentences.
That's funny. Never thought Metro Man was the gloating type.
Oh, but he does have nice taste. I think I'll keep it.
Any chance you could give me the time?
I don't want to be late for the opening of the Metro Man Museum.
Oh, no. Looks like you're gonna miss it.
By several thousand years!
It's a beautiful day in beautiful downtown, where we're here to honor a beautiful man...
Metro Man.
His heart is an ocean that's inside a bigger ocean.
For years, he's been watching us with his super-vision, saving us with his super-strength and caring for us with his super-heart.
Now, it's our turn to give something back.
This is Roxanne Ritchi, reporting live from the dedication of the Metro Man Museum.
that's un-freaking-believable. It's crazy.
I wrote that piece myself, Hal.
What I was trying to say was, I can't believe that in our modern society they let, like, actual art get onto the news.
like, let's just get a coffee or something.
Well, if I were Metro Man, Megamind wouldn't be kidnapping you all the time.
And I'd be watching you like a dingo watches a human baby.
-Mm. -Okay, that sounded...
-Okay, that sounded a little weird. -A little bit, yeah.
You're making a weird face and that's making me feel weird.
...like something watching something intently with love.
Not love. We're not in love. I'm not saying I love you.
I'm in love with you, I'm saying...
Roxanne? Roxaroo?
Whoa. What are you doing, guys?
-Oh, you fools. He's tricked us. -You were right.
Well, hello, good-looking! Need a lift?
Certainly do, you fantastic fish, you!
All right. Put your hands in the air!
Ladies and gentlemen... your Metro Man!
Yeah, Metro City!
Give me some. Come on. Give it now. Give it to me. Right on!
Give me the good stuff. All right!
You know, I just want to bring it down a bit.
Boys, a little lower. Thank you, fellas.
Let's get real for a moment.
That's right. That's right.
Although getting a whole museum is super cool... super cool...
you wanna know what the greatest honor you've given me is?
I'll tell you. The greatest honor you've given me is...
letting me serve you, the helpless people of Metro City.
who would I be, without you?
Ah! I tell you, Minion, there's no place like evil lair.

-Disgustingly horrifying, sir. -You always know what to say.
Oh, the brainbots certainly missed you, sir.
Did you miss your daddy? Who's a menacing little cyborg?
No, no, no, no.
You want the wrench? Go get the wrench!
-Oh, look at that. -Now, back to laughing.
Miss Ritchi... we meet again.
Would it kill you to wash the bag?
You can scream all you wish, Miss Ritchi!
I'm afraid no one can hear you!
Wha...? Why isn't she screaming?
Miss Ritchi, if you don't mind.
He's a little better.

won't work on me...
-Please talk slower. -...temptress!

Boo!
Yes, I can play along, too. Boo!
Should have known you'd try to crash the party.
Oh, I intend to do more than crash it.
This is a day you and Metrocity shall not soon forget!
Oh, potato, tomato, potato, tomato.
We all know how this ends... with you behind bars.
Oh, I'm shaking in my custom baby seal leather boots.

No, we're not! Don't listen to her. She's crazy.
Metro Man approaching, sir.
Hold on a second.
Oh, good heavens!
You didn't think you were in the real observatory, did you?
-Ready the death ray, Minion. -Death ray readying.
you've fallen right into my trap.
You can't trap justice. It's an idea, a belief.
Even the most heartfelt belief can be corroded over time.
Justice is a non-corrosive metal.
But metals can be melted by the heat of revange!
It's revenge and it's best served cold!
But it can be easily reheated in the microwave of evil!
Well, I think your warranty's about to expire.
Maybe I got an extended warranty!
Warranties are invalid if you don't use the product for its intended purpose!
Of course. That is, if Metro Man can withstand the full concentrated power of the sun!
Fire!
Minion... fire?

The sun is warming up?

and... just...
tippy-tappy, tippy-tap-tap, tip-top more...

I told you to have things ready.

My spider bite is acting up!
Your plan is failing. Just admit it.

You mad genius! Your dark gift has finally paid off!

I did it?
He did it.
I did it?
He did it.

First off, what a turnout!
All I did was eliminate the most powerful man in the universe.
Are there any questions? Go on.

Good. I'm glad you asked that.

and multiply it by six!
with the dreary, normal things you normal people do!
Let's just have fun with this, come on! And I will get back to you.
Oh, Minion, did you think this day would ever come?
Never. Never in a million-- I mean... yes, I did!
I'm looking, I'm looking!
And what's this?

but it seems to only carry one station.

Oh...
I've never had a view before.
Metrocity, Minion. It's all mine!

Sir, I'm sure they're smiling down from evil heaven.

Always thirsty, never satisfied.
I understand you, little well-dressed bird.
Purposeless... emptiness.

I'm in a heated existential discussion with this dead-eyed plastic desk toy.
Is... is something wrong, sir?
Just think about it.
We have it all.
Yet we have nothing.
It's just too easy now.
I'm sorry, you've lost me, sir.
I mean... we did it, right?
Uh, well, you did it, sir. Yes, you've made that perfectly clear.
Then why do I feel so... melon-choly?
-Melon-choly? -Unhappy.
What if, tomorrow, we could go kidnap Roxanne Ritchi?
Good idea, Minion. But without him, what's the point?
-Him, sir? -Nothing.
That's something to consider, and, um, well, I think I'll just power down for a while, then.
Dependable.
Perhaps we took him for granted.
Maybe we never really know how good we have it until it's gone.
We miss you, Metro Man.
I... miss you.
And I have just one question for Megamind.
Are you happy now?
Coming up next: are you ready to be a slave army?
What you need to know.
and give it to a child on Christmas!
-'Cause we're done. -Okay. See you tomorrow, Hal.

I don't really feel like being around a bunch of people.
No, no, no, that's the best part. It'll just be like you and me.

I did hire a wedding photographer.

Like maybe we should have this for, like, ever.

Cool. So, Thursday? Soft Thursday?

I didn't mean to destroy you.
I mean, I meant to destroy you, but I didn't think it would really work.
Without you, evil is running rampant through the streets.
I'm so tired of running rampant through the streets.
What's the point of being bad when there's no good to try and stop you?
-Bernard. -Bernard.
You probably think I'm a little bit nuts.
I'm not allowed to insult guests directly.

The illiteracy beam. Typhoon cheese.
Robo-sheep.

You know, before I destroy the place.
too many painful memories.
Costume?
Megamind's head is not that grossly exaggerated.

We're having the walls and ceiling removed.
Wow, that sounds like quite the renovation.
I guess I'll, um... catch a ride down with you then.

Yeah. He was really good at those.

That's it! All you need are the right ingredients.

-Strength. -Of course!

Time to put the past behind us.

Create a hero? Wait. What?

Minion, I'm a villain without a hero.
A yin with no yang.
A bullfighter with no bull to fight. In other words, I have no purpose!
Now, ask me how I'm going to do it. Go on! Ask!
I'm going to give someone, I don't know who yet, Metro Man's powers.
I'm going to train that someone to become Metrocity's new hero!
Over here! Follow! And then, finally, I'm going to fight that hero in an epic battle of good and evil!
Which will put everything back the way it was when the world was perfect and rosy!

Look closely. Tell me what you see.

Yes! This is a very wickedly bad idea for the greater good of bad!

Oh, you don't know what's good for bad!
Now, we have just one shot at this.
We must find a suitable subject. Someone of noble heart and mind, who puts the welfare of others above their own.

Yeah, it's been a while. Feels pretty good.

Now, look at it. It's a dump.

But how? Why?

Whoo-hoo!

Really?

Well, in sh-- school, none of the other kids really liked me.
I was always the last one picked for everything.

Hal, I think you're ready for this.
You make me laugh.
It stretches. It's for you.

Titan.

Oh.

That's very good.

unsheathe your churro. One, two, three.

It's just my natural musk. Now, where are the car keys?

Sir. Sir, please, it's for your own good!
Oh, what do you know?

-is to look after you. -Well, I don't need you to look after me!

Code: Fine!

Titan.

Oh, right, right! Duh. I got you! I got you!

Okay, all right. All right. Hold on.
-Are you crazy? -I suppose I'm a little crazy...
about you.
Who are you, really?
Oh, right.
Well, prepare to have your mind blown, little lady.
Ta-da.
Now there's nothing keeping us apart.

Look, there is no us, okay? There will never be an us.

I have a cape. I'm the good guy.
You are a good guy, Hal, but you don't understand.

Wow! Your hair looks exciting.

Megamind's created a new hero, and I know why.
It all makes sense now.

...so he created a new hero to kick it for him.
Hal is the worst possible person you could pick.
Wow. That's a lot to take in.
I am extremely boggled.
You know, I'm sure we'll get to the bottom of who's kicking whose butt, but in the meantime, let's enjoy each other's company.
To Bernard... for being the only normal thing in my crazy, upside-down world.
To... being normal.
-Roxanne? -Yes?
Say I wasn't so normal.
Let's say I was bald, and had the complexion of a popular primary color, as a random, nonspecific example.
-Would you still enjoy my company? -Of course.
You don't judge a book by its cover or a person from the outside.
Well, that seems kind of petty, don't you think?
Just a technical glitch! Don't look yet.
Where were we?
Ugh!
-You. -Now, hold on.
You!
What about everything you've just said?

Well, let's take a look at the contents, then, shall we?

You took over the city and then, you actually got me to care about you!
Tricking me?
What could you possibly hope to gain?
Wait a minute. Oh, I don't believe this.
